Thanks for all the help. I just needed that extra leverage which can 
make =
the test to generate log files that are user friendly and a 
person can und=
erstand whats going on in the tests without going 
through the source code.=
 I happened to get help from one of the 
guys "Ilja Preu=DF's" and he has p=
osted me a link regd. logging in 
information. May be it will be of help fo=
r user with similar reqmnts. 
http://www.openfuture.de/Log4Unit/


--- In j=
unit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> 
wrote:
> Anshumaa=
n Rajshiva wrote:
> 
> > I want to know a way by which i can dump useful in=
formation in a 
test
> > case using JUNIT even if it is passing. Till now, =
all the assert
> > statements throws message only if the statement fails. I=
 want to 
know
> > is there a way to dump a message even if the assert stat=
ement 
passes??
> 
> You could just print to the console, or adding logging=
 to your test 
cases.
> 
> One of the design philosophies behind JUnit is t=
hat, if all the 
tests 
> pass, we only care about seeing an "OK" or a gree=
n bar. We only 
want 
> information if tests fail. That is why, "out of the=
 box", JUnit 
does not 
> provide information about passing tests.
> 
> Tak=
e care.
